for_sales.sales_text:
Sea Daisy is a Tamarisk 24 designed by David Cannell and built by North Cornwall in 1981. She has a solidly built GRP hull with sheathed wooden topsides and wooden spars. She was designed in the style of the traditional late 19th century fishing boats from the Itchen Ferry yards on the Hamble. In 2024 she finished a complete professional overhaul with replacement of much of the deck, the mast base, the cockpit and cabin hatch cover. Internally she has been completely refurbished and painted. Compared with other Tamarisk 24’ s she is very roomy with a spacious main cabin, separate heads and a door to the forward cabin. The galley area has a fairly new gas two burner with grill but room for a cooker with oven. She has berths for 4 with a table that will drop to accommodate part of a double berth. She has a complete suit of sails, warps etc. Her engine is a reliable Bukh 10 which will move her up to 6 knots in calm waters. Also fine sea legs. Sea Daisy is fine example of a Tamarisk and a good solid seaworthy boat, looking in prime condition.

Currently stored under cover.

We have owned her since 2010.

She has :

Her original interior ,V berth in the fore cabin ,double berth in main cabin plus a quarter berth.

Galley with 2 ring gas cooker with grill and sink.

Seperate heads with sea toilet.

Engine Bukh DV10.

Sails ; Main sail ,brown by Westaway . 2 x Stay sail , one requires a minor stitching repair .

2 x Gib .Top sail and Storm Gib .
